channel.title: Brother can't connect?
channel.description: OK, well I've port forwarded 43594 TCP and DUP, I have had servers before, so I have experience with that. For the first time ever my brother is going to play. So he downloaded client etc. Oh and also I have no-ip already installed. Anyways he can't connect and server is up. Would he connect to the server ip or use 0.0.0.0? Also do I have to have my server registered on the server status page for others to connect to it or not?

item.dc:creator: @Oriks Oriks
item.description:

it work?

item.title: Brother can't connect?
item.dc:creator: @Oriks Oriks
item.description:
@Oriks wrote:

do this, Start>Run> type CMD>type ipconfig > look for your ip address that starts with 192.168.xxx.xxx(might be different)
then use that also if you want to go public then use dyndns.com it’s 100% better then no-ip.org and you don’t need software.

Read full topic

item.title: Brother can't connect?
item.dc:creator: @2xbladex2 2xbladex2
item.description:
@2xbladex2 wrote:

What, do you mean “Invalid ip”? I have downloaded and installed no-ip DUC. I have a smiley face beside it like I always do. I don’t believe thats the problem.

Read full topic

item.title: Brother can't connect?

Its a invalid ip possibly?

item.title: Brother can't connect?
item.dc:creator: @2xbladex2 2xbladex2
item.description:
@2xbladex2 wrote:

Anyways, I tryed hosting my server on sever status page. It said its offline, whilst I do have it online. That would explain why my brother can’t connect. I’ve portforwarded my router, so I don’t believe thats the problem. What else could be a problem why others can’t connect, any idea\suggestions?

Read full topic

item.title: Brother can't connect?
item.dc:creator: @EatU4Dinner EatU4Dinner
item.description:
@EatU4Dinner wrote:

some sources have a anti syi system. what this means is, basicly only 1 log in per ip. now if ur brother does have another ip then…idk but try searching how to remove syi anti systems?

Read full topic

item.title: Brother can't connect?
item.dc:creator: @yourusername yourusername
item.description:
@yourusername wrote:

do u have 1 connection so 1 of you can only log in i think ur both connected to same router…

Read full topic

item.title: Brother can't connect?
item.dc:creator: @Darkning Darkning
item.description:
@Darkning wrote:

I don’t think so. This happens if my friend comes over. i have my server hosted on my laptop (connected to my router). He will use my Desktop, which is also connected to my router. Only one of us can log in, it is mostly me on my laptop. If i connect to someone else wireless connection we can both log in.

Read full topic

item.title: Brother can't connect?
item.dc:creator: @2xbladex2 2xbladex2
item.description:
@2xbladex2 wrote:

Hmm, I don’t believe so. We’re all connecting to it, buts it a multi-connection router. Also hes connected wirelessly and im connecting locally. Thus our ip’s are different.

P.S.- I believe I had this problem before, I posted on server status page then it worked. Would this be the problem possibly?

Read full topic

item.title: Brother can't connect?
item.dc:creator: @Darkning Darkning
item.description:
@Darkning wrote:

If you are all using the same router/modem, then that might be the problem.

Read full topic

item.title: Brother can't connect?
item.dc:creator: @2xbladex2 2xbladex2
item.description:
@2xbladex2 wrote:

We have 3 computers, my dad is connected to the router/modem. So he is LAN. I’m connected through a wired connection so i’m LAN. My brother is connected wirelessly. So I don’t believe we’re the same ip. Also I tryed 0.0.0.0 and the ip for the server for him. About the 1 connection per IP, i’m not logged in atm.

Read full topic

item.title: Brother can't connect?
item.dc:creator: @Darkning Darkning
item.description:
@Darkning wrote:

Well, if you are both under the same router/modem then try 127.0.0.1 or 0.0.0.0 If that does not work try the no-ip. Most of the time you will not be able to connect because the registered IP addresses are the same. Your server might be set to one connection per IP.

Read full topic
